H0.text: Prefixes are used to indicate the number of atoms of an element that are in the compound.

H1.text: Indices are used to indicate the number of atoms of an element that are present in a compound.

H2.text: Suffixes are used to indicate the number of atoms of an element that are in the compound.

H3.text: Digits are used to indicate the number of atoms of an element that are in the compound.

A4.text: Chemical formulae most often use integers for each element.

A5.text: The empirical formula of a chemical is a simple expression of the relative number of each type of atom or ratio of the elements in the compound.
